info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 01 at 5:31PM CST until March 01 at 6:15PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Polk County in western Arkansas... Montgomery County in western Arkansas... * Until 615 PM CST. * At 531 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Little Missouri Falls Recreation Area, or 14 miles northeast of Umpire, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Mount Ida... Glenwood... Norman... Oden... Opal... Mimosa... Little Missouri Falls Recreatio... Bard Springs Recreation Area... Mauldin... Albert Pike Recreation Area... Black Springs... Big Fork... Fannie... Fancyhill... Welsh... Silver... Roaring Branch Natural Area... Hopper... Hurricane Grove... Caddo Gap... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for central, western and southwestern Arkansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for central, western and southwestern Arkansas.
